summary:
=== Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/04/15 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Mark Andrews', 'Brenda Chapman'], 'Producers': ['Katherine Sarafian'], 'Starring': ['Kelly Macdonald', 'Billy Connolly', 'Emma Thompson']} Review Text: Bows, bears (cute and scary) and outrageous Scots! What more could you ask for?

OK seriously. The animation is top notch. The stylized and compelling use of shape and color for the characters, the graceful gesture and action, and the gorgeous scenery are all really what you would expect from Disney in top form. A pleasure to look at.

The story is delightful, funny and light-hearted. I love the premise of a princess fiercely defending her independence and the conflict between freedom and duty that arises. Review Title: funny and light-hearted Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/07/10 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Don Hall', 'Chris Williams'], 'Producers': ['Roy Conli'], 'Starring': ['T.J. Miller', 'Jamie Chung', 'Maya Rudolph']} Review Text: Great movie. I love cartoons, and they don't necessarily have to be great for me to enjoy them, but this one was. There is so much that's right. I love the nerds, they're clichéd in ways, but whatever, they're enjoyable in their quirkiness--and it at least feels like the writers tried to dismantle some stereotypes. I like the mixed cultures pieces. I like the acceptance of each of the characters for the others, the understanding they expressed, and their tolerance and compassion. And I love stories that play with the realities, and also abstractly philosophical not-so-realities of life and death.

And a fat, inflatable robot is genius. Review Title: Great movie. I love cartoons Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: The Fifth Element (Ultimate Edition) Review Date: 2017/08/05 Store: Bruce Willis (Actor), Gary Oldman (Actor), Luc Besson (Director) & 0 more Rated: PG-13 Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Science Fiction & Fantasy, Science Fiction, Aliens Product Description: ['Product Description', "New York cab driver Korben Dallas didn't mean to be a hero, but he just picked up the kind of fare that only comes along every five thousand years: A perfect beauty, a perfect being, a perfect weapon. Together, they must save the world. Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich, and Gary Oldman star in acclaimed director Luc Besson's outrageous sci-fi adventure, an extravagantly styled tale of good against evil set in an unbelievable twenty-third century world. Now presented in full 4K resolution, experience this dynamic action favorite like never before.", 'Set Contains:', 'Because of its striking vision and slam-bang sci-fi action,', 'The Fifth Element', "has long been a prime show-off disc for home-theater owners. The third DVD release, the two-disc Ultimate Edition, is the best one yet. It's essentially a Superbit Deluxe DVD, reserving the first disc for the film in a high bit-rate picture and DTS sound borrowed from the earlier Superbit DVD (a tiny Superbit logo is displayed on the back cover) and an interesting though barely legible subtitled trivia track (text only so it doesn't take much disc space). From the greater detail to the more natural colors, it's a better viewing experience overall. The second disc contains two hours of featurettes, produced in 2004 and new to DVD. In fact, it's the first", 'Fifth Element', "DVD to have supplemental features of any kind. Topics covered include visual effects, how the aliens were created, Milla Jovovich's screen tests (you can watch four of them), and the French artists whose comic books provided the initial inspiration and earned them an invitation to work with the design team. Jovovich, Bruce Willis, and everyone else involved in the picture seems to make an appearance, except director Luc Besson.", '--David Horiuchi'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.6 x 5.4 x 7.5 inches; 6.4 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'COLD07438D', 'Director': 'Luc Besson', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, DTS Surround Sound, NTSC, Special Edition, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 6 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 11, 2005', 'Actors': 'Bruce Willis, Gary Oldman, Ian Holm, Chris Tucker, Milla Jovovich', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French, Portuguese, Thai', 'Producers': 'Patrice Ledoux', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, English (DTS 5.1)', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '2'} Review Text: With Luc Besson making a new comic book movie I got inspired to watch The Fifth Element again. I haven't seen it since it first came out, and I was worried that I wouldn't enjoy it as I had in my youth, but I must say that it is a better movie than I recall. The story is more interesting in the telling than the content but visually this film it spectacular, scene after scene it's just a work of art. Style, characters, color, theme and mood all merge into one of the more interesting things I've had the pleasure to watch in my life. Review Title: Actually better than I remember it Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/08/13 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Byron Howard', 'Rich Moore'], 'Producers': ['Clark Spencer'], 'Starring': ['Ginnifer Goodwin', 'Jason Bateman', 'Idris Elba']} Review Text: The scenes and settings are pretty amazing. The story is actually more interesting an nuanced than I would have expected, much more so that I suspected from the trailers.

The investment in the really rich worldbuilding also makes this a great case study for anyone interested in storytelling.

I'm a cartoon junky and would watch Gazelle music videos in preference to those of the woman who gave the character her voice. Review Title: Pretty amazing Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/04/28 Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Francis Ford Coppola'], 'Producers': ['Gray Fredrickson', 'Fred Roos', 'Francis Ford Coppola'], 'Starring': ['Al Pacino', 'Robert Duvall', 'Diane Keaton']} Review Text: This is a rare case where I think the sequel is superior to the original.

Pacino's performance is top notch, but De Niro's portrayal of a young Vito Corleone was probably the highlight for me. The parallel stories, the cycles of beginnings and endings and new beginnings, and strong, individualistic character arcs for many, many characters make for a deep story, rich with intrigue, suspense, and mystery.

The artistry is superb, camera work, sound, etc. are all masterful and will draw you in and fix your attention throughout this 200 minute behemoth of a classic. Review Title: Superb, captivating classic, better than its predecessor Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/04/30 Average Rating: 4.6 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'foul language', 'drug use'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Christopher Nolan'], 'Producers': ['Christopher Nolan', 'Emma Thomas'], 'Starring': ['Leonardo DiCaprio', 'Ken Watanabe', 'Joseph Gordon-Levitt'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Review Text: This is an excellent movie. I don't watch many movies more than once, usually I just don't find that there is terribly much to revisit. This one is an exception. There is so much that is interesting, the story, the scenery, music, etc. are all well done, but it's the treatment of the principle idea, and the way the suspense and mystery roll out that really keeps me engaged each time.

Often with speculative fiction there is an interesting basic premise, and then a poor execution, or the characters have to engage in endless dialog about it so that the audience will get it. I feel like this movies avoids those pitfalls well. The thread of the premise weaves in and out and you really can't say that you have it all until almost the end, and even then... no spoilers.

Finally, top notch score. Worth owning all on its own. Review Title: Excellent, well worth multiple viewings Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
This individual's purchase history highlights a strong preference for high-quality animated films and well-crafted narratives across various genres, particularly science fiction and drama. Consistently high ratings, often at or near 5.0, indicate a tendency to enjoy visually stunning productions with deep storytelling, engaging character arcs, and themes of independence, complexity, and humor. Recurring mentions of rich worldbuilding and artistic excellence suggest an appreciation for creative storytelling, balancing humor with serious themes.

The buyer appears to favor movies from notable directors and franchises, reflecting a preference for established brands often associated with quality, which implies a moderate price sensitivity—opting for higher-priced but well-reviewed options rather than low-cost alternatives. Additionally, the individual’s enjoyment of diverse cultural elements and philosophical undertones illustrates an openness to varied perspectives and intricate plots. 

Overall, the core preferences manifest as a combination of valuing artistic merit, depth in narratives, and a penchant for emotional engagement through character-driven stories, with a keen eye for visually impactful and intellectually stimulating cinematic experiences.

target_interaction.title: interesting premise, mediocre execution
target_interaction.text:
This movie starts from an interesting premise, the commodification of the duration of one's life, with the wealthy being effectively immortal, and thus willing to do anything to protect their claim and the poor working day to day just to stay alive, literally.

Whereas it's a pretty obvious condemnation of modern capitalism, the maintenance of artificial scarcities by the owning class and the subjugation of the working class, I actually think that on the whole it successfully avoids being overly moralistic or preachy... I mean a little, but bearable.

A good starting point but the premise is rather shallowly explored and unrealistically executed, it suffers from YA like corny melodrama and some of the pitfalls and limitations of the visual medium, i.e. needing to be able to see the metaphor/action (such as containers of time) or else fall back on, sadly yes, expository narration/dialog.

That said, it's an enjoyable way to spend the better part of 2 hours.
